info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 3:06PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern McDowell, northeastern Rutherford, northwestern Cleveland and south central Burke Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 306 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Marion, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Casar, South Mountains State Park, Sugar Hill, Thermal City, Glenwood, Fero, Dysartsville and Sunshine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
